item.title: Go vs Python
item.description: Slices Go slice and Python slice have very similar syntax, but Python slice is a shallow copy of part of the original list, while Go slice is just a new range within the same underlying array of the original slice. Let’s try: a = [1, 2, 3] b = a[:2] b[0] = 9 print(a) print(b) # output: # [1, 2, 3] # [9, 2] See a[0] remains the same.
